meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: TERRORISM

div.a: Is Al Qaeda Still A Threat?

div.div: Eleven years after 9/11, al Qaeda is fighting back.
PR FAILS

div.a: How Press Releases Rewrote Scientific History

div.div: This week the ENCODE project released the results of its latest attempt to catalog all the activities associated with the human genome. Chances are you read about it. If you did, there's a good chance that you were mislead.
INFOGRAPHICS
Pinterest has seen such explosive growth that the natural question is: what next? Pay attention to the data, and you might be able to guess.
YES, THIS EXISTS

div.a: The Science Of Fruit Salad Trees

div.div: In Australia, James and Kerry West grow and sell four types of fruit salad trees, each of which bears several different kinds of fruit. Unfortunately, you still have to slice the fruit yourself.
INFOGRAPHICS

div.a: How To Divine A Person's Political Views Without Even Asking

div.div: Congress Labs has investigated the Facebook profiles of millions of Obama and Romney fans and drawn some interesting conclusions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S2nhKj&via=Digg&text=How To Divine A Person's Political Views Without Even Asking

div.div: SERIOUSLY?

div.a: Yelp Flamewar Breaks Out Over Pizza Owner's Obama Bear Hug

div.div: The latest comments on Big Apple Pizza's Yelp page aren't about anchovies.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QEY200&via=Digg&text=Yelp Flamewar Breaks Out Over Pizza Owner's Obama Bear Hug

div.div: NEVER FORGET... AGAIN

div.a: The September 11th Catastrophe You've Probably Never Heard About

div.div: On September 11, 1957, a national catastrophe was unfolding, one you likely have never heard about before.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P7VCJz&via=Digg&text=The September 11th Catastrophe You've Probably Never Heard About

div.div: NIPPLEGATE II

div.a: Why Facebook Is About To Ban 'New Yorker' Cartoons

div.div: Facebook's anti-nudity policy is causing a headache for the famed magazine.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UFdwFw&via=Digg&text=Why Facebook Is About To Ban 'New Yorker' Cartoons

div.div: FRIENDSHIP
You love all things foreign. But despite the repeated olive-oiled anointing your pastor gave you and your passport, you failed to get a visa.
CRIME

div.a: Does The FBI Have An Informant Problem?

div.div: Professional informants are paid by law enforcement to infiltrate criminal or extremist circles, sometimes on a full-time basis. Yet they're not considered employees of the government and are not subject to the same rules.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TxkI75&via=Digg&text=Does The FBI Have An Informant Problem?

div.div: HACKED

div.a: Amid Outage, GoDaddy Moves DNS To Competitor VeriSign

div.div: Following a day-long Domain Name Service server outage, web hosting provider GoDaddy is letting its competitor, VeriSign, host its DNS servers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q9TwKY&via=Digg&text=Amid Outage, GoDaddy Moves DNS To Competitor VeriSign

div.div: HEALTH

div.a: Vaccine Trials Reveal Chinks In HIV's Armor

div.div: HIV is finally revealing its weak spots to researchers, bringing an effective vaccine against AIDS closer to reality.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RyuuXp&via=Digg&text=Vaccine Trials Reveal Chinks In HIV's Armor

div.div: TWEET AT THEM
While e-mail remains the official method of communication on most campuses, colleges are expanding their presence in the virtual world, trying to reach students where they hang out.
EXCELLENT IDEA OF THE DAY
Could swarms of robots help repair coral reefs threatened by bottom-trolling fishing methods?
STOP KICKING CNN, IT'S ALREADY DEAD

div.a: BuzzFeed Partners With Video News Startup

div.div: The video news startup code-named Planet Daily has unveiled its real name — NowThis News — and announced a strategic partnership with BuzzFeed.
